title.narrative: QUALITY OF EDUCATION

description.narrative: Education duty bearers and rights holders at national and sub-national level have increased capacity to plan for, implement and monitor a child friendly education environment and develop and monitor student learning outcomes., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EDUCATION outcome: Girls and boys of school age especially vulnerable children in deprived provinces and areas, access primary education that is progressively child friendly and demonstrates improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education duty bearers and rights holders at national and sub-national level have increased capacity to plan for, implement andmonitor a child friendly education environment and develop and monitor student learning outcomes.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support interventions aimed at improving the quality of education in teacher development and learning assessment. In 2021, the evaluation of GATE program was conducted, and the report finalized. A total of 513 Academic Supervisors received training on new skills of supervision and mentorship, technical assistance was contracted to support the MoE capacity for the development of standardized test items as part of roll out of the National Assessment Framework for Afghanistan (NAFA), 1,060 girls supported through the Girls’ Access to Teacher Education (GATE) initiative, baseline survey of student learning achievement conducted, and report generated. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:12/01/2022
